description.narrative: The Strengthening Secondary Education Project aims to improve efficiency of the educational system. The project emphasizes mathematics and science and contributes to the expansion of practical studies in general secondary education. Besides, it aims at improving the coordination and supervision of educational activities in Lesotho. In addition, the project supports Government policies and priorities regarding educational, social and economic development. Moreover, the project should strengthen the Central Inspectorate, the National Curriculum Development Centre, the Examination Council, the Central Materials Supply Unit and the Training for Self-Reliance Project (TSRP) implementation unit. Finally, the project should help to better plan, the physical development of secondary and high schools in Lesotho. The project encompasses seven main components, namely: (i) Secondary and High Schools; (ii) Central Inspectorate; (iii) National Curriculum Development Centre; (iv) Examination Council; (v) Central Materials Supply Unit; (vi) Secondary School Development Study and (vii) Project Implementation.
The beneficiaries of the project are students, teachers, educational authorities and other actors in the education system.

The project aims at improving the standards of existing secondary and high schools through the provision of twenty science laboratories and twenty practical subjects workshops in the thirty-three schools, as well as forty teachers houses in thirty-three of those schools located in rural schools.

participating-org.narrative: GOVERNMENT OF LESOTHO MINISTRY OF FINANCE
